item.title: Java - Coders help. [STUCK]
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[code]public class FileArrayProvider {

public String[] statName = readLines("file.here");
public String[] readLines(String filename) throws IOException {
    FileReader fileReader = new FileReader(filename);
    BufferedReader bufferedReader = new BufferedReader(fileReader);
    List<String> lines = new ArrayList<String>();
    String line = null;
    while ((line = bufferedReader.readLine()) != null) {
        lines.add(line);
    }
    bufferedReader.close();
    return lines.toArray(new String[lines.size()]);
}

}[/code]

idk if it will work, but i fixed a few things, try it.

item.title: Java - Coders help. [STUCK]
item.dc:creator: @PKERZ PKERZ
item.description:
@PKERZ wrote:

Well, Della, as I said, what you are doing wrong is, you are declaring a method with two (2) return-types. The first being “String” and the second being “statname[]”. First of all, you cannot have two (2) return-types, and second of all, I don’t think you made a class with the name “statname”, which in turn makes it impossible to use that, even if you have only one (1) return-type.

To make it easier for you, let me show an example of a correct way to do it. Obviously this one will have its method-body omitted for convenience’ sake:

public String readLines(String filename) throws IOException {...}

And to introduce you to the words I used earlier, here they are side-by-side:

public - This is an access-modifier.
String - This is the return-type for the method.
readLines - This is the name of the method.
(String filename) - This is the parameter-list of the method.

And also, your “statname[]” was also referring to a return-type, making it duplicate.

Read full topic

item.title: Java - Coders help. [STUCK]
item.dc:creator: @Della Della
item.description:
@Della wrote:

Well i tried to delete the [], and no i don’t see what i’m doing wrong since i’m all new to JAVA, and where should i put the dir.? and how ?

EDIT here is my code in muddclient.java

Import

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

The Code.

public class FileArrayProvider {


    public String StatName = readLines(String filename) throws IOException {
        FileReader fileReader = new FileReader(filename);
        BufferedReader bufferedReader = new BufferedReader(fileReader);
        List<String> lines = new ArrayList<String>();
        String line = null;
        while ((line = bufferedReader.readLine()) != null) {
            lines.add(line);
        }
        bufferedReader.close();
        return lines.toArray(new String[lines.size()]);
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Java - Coders help. [STUCK]
item.dc:creator: @Della Della
item.description:
@Della wrote:

so…

I decided to do what Peter said and here i am…

in Client source theres…

public String statname[] = {
“Attack”, “Defence”, “Strength”, “Hits”, “Ranged”, “Prayer”, “Magic”, “Cooking”,
“Woodcut”, “Fletching”, “Fishing”, “Firemaking”, “Crafting”, “Smithing”, “Mining”, “Herblaw”, “Agility”,
“Thieving”};

and i read something in google and made it like this.

public String statname[] readLines(String filename) throws IOException {
    FileReader fileReader = new FileReader(filename);
    BufferedReader bufferedReader = new BufferedReader(fileReader);
    List<String> lines = new ArrayList<String>();
    String line = null;
    while ((line = bufferedReader.readLine()) != null) {
        lines.add(line);
    }
    bufferedReader.close();
    return lines.toArray(new String[lines.size()]);
}

}

But i get this error

-----------------------ERROR-----------------------------------------

mudclient.java:10269: ‘;’ expected
public String statname[] readLines(String filename) throws IOException {
^
mudclient.java:10269: invalid method declaration; return type required
public String statname[] readLines(String filename) throws IOException {
^

I hope some1 can help… Thanks.
